alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 5:48AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Jefferson, eastern Shawnee, central Douglas and northeastern Osage Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 546 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Topeka to 3 miles north of Berryton to near Carbondale. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Lawrence, Carbondale, Oskaloosa, Tecumseh, Eudora, Richland, Perry, McLouth, Scranton, Lecompton, Clinton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Pauline, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Grantville, Clinton Lake and Berryton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 352 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 170 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
